Description: Fragment of a scarab, made of steatite, about a quarter of the scarab is preserved. Fine details carved, whitish-beige colour with incised lines filled with dark green glaze. The division between elytra and prothorax is indicated by an incised line, as is the suture. One of the humeral callosities is preserved on the right elytron, showing an incised triangle. Also at the side of prothorax and elytron a line indicating the end of the wing cover. Head and clypeus with 2 lobes preserved (originally probably 4), The side shows two circumferential line defining an area of stylised legs and a base part. The seal at the base shows faint traces of an oval line framing the base very close to the edge. Parts of three hieroglyphic signs preserved, probably a nb-basket at the base of the seal, on top maybe the lower part of an uraeus. Medium quality. Part of the longitudinal perforation is preserved.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
